page.title: 01Overview
page.content: The area that we have been allocated is about 25 miles NE of London and is mainly used for crop farming. It is bounded by Fryerning, Blackmore, Ingatestone and Mountnessing, but none of these villages is included to any great extent and there are very few items of real interest. This has traditionally been a farming area, but there has been a change from animal to arable farming. Some woods have gradually been cleared to make way for more arable land and many of the smaller farms have been "swallowed up" so that there are now only two or three farming families. There has never been much of a population and so the facilities are few, with public transport only passing through the SE corner from Brentwood to Chelmsford, along the old Roman road.
